attributes.description: Makes resources such as visualizations or dashboards knowable, which are maintained by Axway.
attributes.name: axway

attributes.description: Entities related to API-Transactions.
attributes.name: apis

attributes.description: Realtime data, which might create heavy load on your Elasticsearch depending on the time range.
attributes.name: real-time

attributes.description: Showing the top 5 organizations owing the called APIs
attributes.title: [Axway] Top 5 API Organisations

attributes.description: Top 10 API-Methods
attributes.title: [Axway] Top 10 Methods by # of Transactions
attributes.visState: {"title":"[Axway] Top 10 Methods by # of Transactions","type":"metrics","aggs":[],"params":{"id":"61ca57f0-469d-11e7-af02-69e470af7417","type":"top_n","series":[{"id":"61ca57f1-469d-11e7-af02-69e470af7417","color":"rgba(203,35,184,1)","split_mode":"terms","split_color_mode":"kibana","metrics":[{"id":"61ca57f2-469d-11e7-af02-69e470af7417","type":"count"}],"separate_axis":0,"axis_position":"right","formatter":"number","chart_type":"line","line_width":1,"point_size":1,"fill":0.5,"stacked":"none","terms_field":"serviceContext.method.keyword","label":"Top 10 API Methods by Transactions"}],"time_field":"","index_pattern":"apigw-traffic-summary*","interval":"","axis_position":"left","axis_formatter":"number","axis_scale":"normal","show_legend":1,"show_grid":1,"tooltip_mode":"show_all","isModelInvalid":false,"bar_color_rules":[{"id":"06bd2660-f1dc-11ea-80f4-5f93522c00f3"}],"pivot_id":"serviceContext.method.keyword","pivot_type":"string","gauge_color_rules":[{"id":"4c3ecfc0-f1de-11ea-80f4-5f93522c00f3"}],"gauge_width":10,"gauge_inner_width":10,"gauge_style":"half","time_range_mode":"entire_time_range","use_kibana_indexes":false,"hide_last_value_indicator":true,"drop_last_bucket":1}}

attributes.description: Uses less granular data, which supports long time ranges, but with limited query/filter options.
attributes.name: historical

attributes.description:
Filter down traffic based on the region/datacenter and API-Gateway the call has been processed. 
This needs to be configured upfront on the Please note that it takes about 3 hours until new configurations are available here, because the data must be rolled up in before.
attributes.title: [Axway] Gateway Selector

attributes.description:
This chart shows the status with which APIs were terminated. It is irrelevant in this chart whether the status was set by the API gateway or the backend system.
It thus provides a good overview of whether APIs can be successfully called from the consumer's perspective or not.
attributes.title: [Axway] API-Status

attributes.description:
This chart shows whether API requests successfully passed the API gateway or were blocked, for example due to missing authentication, security problems, quotas, etc.
If successfully passed APIs requests unexpectedly have a negative return code, such as 500, then it was returned by the backend system and not by the API gateway.
attributes.title: [Axway] API-Gateway status

attributes.description: Shows the top 20 API-Requests incl. security, custom policies and backend.
attributes.title: [Axway] Top 20 API-Requests

attributes.description: The top 10 API-Methods in the selected time-frame based on the given filters.
attributes.title: [Axway] Top 10 API Methods by Transactions

attributes.description: Shows the top 20 Applications
attributes.title: [Axway] Top 20 Applications

attributes.description: Overview of the top 20 APIs and their API request status in the selected time period.
attributes.title: [Axway] Status by API

attributes.description: Monitor the status of your APIs. Status information, performance and appropriate filtering options. Information is almost real-time and with that, the time range is limited.
attributes.title: [Axway] API-Requests Real-Time

attributes.description: Shows the top 10 API-Organizations ordered by the number of API-Calls.
attributes.title: [Axway] Top 10 API-Organizations

attributes.description: Shows the top 10 applications ordered by the number of API-Calls.
attributes.title: [Axway] Top 10 Applications

attributes.description: The number of API-Requests per day.
attributes.title: [Axway] API-Request history daily
attributes.visState: {"title":"[Axway] API-Request history daily","type":"histogram","aggs":[{"id":"1","enabled":true,"type":"sum","params":{"field":"correlationId.value_count","customLabel":"Number of requests"},"schema":"metric"},{"id":"2","enabled":true,"type":"date_histogram","params":{"field":"@timestamp","timeRange":{"from":"now-90d","to":"now"},"useNormalizedEsInterval":true,"scaleMetricValues":false,"interval":"d","drop_partials":false,"min_doc_count":1,"extended_bounds":{},"customLabel":"Number of requests per day"},"schema":"segment"},{"id":"3","enabled":true,"type":"terms","params":{"field":"finalStatus","orderBy":"1","order":"asc","size":5,"otherBucket":false,"otherBucketLabel":"Other","missingBucket":false,"missingBucketLabel":"Missing"},"schema":"group"}],"params":{"type":"histogram","grid":{"categoryLines":true,"valueAxis":"ValueAxis-1"},"categoryAxes":[{"id":"CategoryAxis-1","type":"category","position":"bottom","show":true,"scale":{"type":"linear"},"labels":{"show":true,"filter":true,"truncate":100},"title":{},"style":{}}],"valueAxes":[{"id":"ValueAxis-1","name":"LeftAxis-1","type":"value","position":"left","show":true,"scale":{"type":"linear","mode":"normal"},"labels":{"show":true,"rotate":0,"filter":false,"truncate":100},"title":{"text":"Number of requests"},"style":{}}],"seriesParams":[{"show":true,"type":"histogram","mode":"stacked","data":{"label":"Number of requests","id":"1"},"interpolate":"linear","valueAxis":"ValueAxis-1","drawLinesBetweenPoints":true,"lineWidth":2,"showCircles":true}],"radiusRatio":0,"addTooltip":true,"detailedTooltip":false,"palette":{"type":"palette","name":"default"},"addLegend":true,"legendPosition":"bottom","times":[],"addTimeMarker":false,"labels":{"show":false},"thresholdLine":{"show":true,"value":5000000,"width":2,"style":"dot-dashed","color":"#fd2f05"}}}

attributes.description: Represents the volume of data received and sent for their API requests.
attributes.title: [Axway] Data volume daily

attributes.description:
This chart shows the status with which APIs were terminated. It is irrelevant in this chart whether the status was set by the API gateway or the backend system.
It thus provides a good overview of whether APIs can be successfully called from the consumer's perspective or not.
attributes.title: [Axway] API-Status history

attributes.description:
This chart shows whether API requests successfully passed the API gateway or were blocked, for example due to missing authentication, security problems, quotas, etc.
If successfully passed APIs requests unexpectedly have a negative return code, such as 500, then it was returned by the backend system and not by the API gateway.
attributes.title: [Axway] API-Gateway status history

attributes.description: This chart shows the hourly processed API-Requests.
attributes.title: [Axway] API-Requests hourly

attributes.description: Shows the top 500 API-Requests based on the selected time-frame and filters.
attributes.title: [Axway] Top 500 API-Requests

attributes.description: Shows the top 500 Applications
attributes.title: [Axway] Top 500 Applications

attributes.description: Overview of the top 20 APIs and their API request status in the selected time period. Based on hourly information.
attributes.title: [Axway] Status by API historical

attributes.description: This dashboard provides a less granular but by default a long-term 90 days overview of daily API requests. Data appears with a delay of 3 hours.
attributes.title: [Axway] API-Requests Quarterly

attributes.description: The number of API-Requests per day.
attributes.title: [Axway] API-Request history monthly

attributes.description: Represents the volume of data received and sent for their API requests.
attributes.title: [Axway] Data volume monthly

attributes.description: This chart shows the daily processed API-Requests.
attributes.title: [Axway] API-Requests daily

attributes.description: This dashboard provides a less granular, but long-term 1-year overview of monthly API requests. Data appears with a delay of 3 hours. Depending on the available data, you can also extend the period to more than 1 year.
attributes.title: [Axway] API-Requests Yearly

attributes.description: Used for objects that are not necessary for every customer.
attributes.name: optional

attributes.description: The number of transactions per month. A transaction may consist of several API requests. Please read more here: https://bit.ly/3sYvXvA
attributes.title: [Axway] API-Transactions per month
